greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into 8 distinct primes.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 77..10000
mathematica: k = 8; b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, Join[{1}, Array[0&, k]], If[i<1, Array[0&, k+1] , Plus @@ PadRight[{b[n, i-1], Join[{0}, If[Prime[i]>n, Array[0&, k], Take[b[n-Prime[i], i-1], k]]]}]]]; a[n_] := b[n, PrimePi[n]][[k+1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 77, 150}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 30 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 14 2012
